title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2023 that focus on complex reasoning in natural language processing (NLP
note: with an emphasis on pretrained language models (PLMs):

title: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** - Liu et al
**"ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations"**
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"**
**"DeBERTa: Decoding-enhanced BERT with Disentangled Attention"** - He et al
**"UnifiedQA: Crossing Format Boundaries with a Single QA System"**
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"**
**"Turing-NLG: A 17-billion-parameter language model by Microsoft"** - Rosset
**"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** - Petroni et al
Analyzing the Knowledge of Language Models"** - Petroni et al
Commonsense Transformers for Automatic Knowledge Graph Construction"** - Bosselut et al
**"Reasoning with Pretrained Transformers in Natural Language Inference"** - Nie et al
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Generalizable Out-of-Distribution Detection"** - Hendrycks et al
**"Zero-Shot Text Classification with Generative Language Models"** - Yin et al
**"Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"Pretrained Language Models for Sequential Sentence Classification"** - Sun et al
**"How Much Knowledge Can You Pack Into the Parameters of a Language Model?"**

These articles cover a range of topics from the development and optimization of PLMs to their application in complex reasoning tasks. They provide a comprehensive overview of the state-of-the-art techniques and methodologies in the field of NLP
